projects.name: Playlist visualisation using Spotify's API
projects.description: During one of our lessons, we had a guest lecturer from Spotify walk us through on how to work with their API to retrieve songs from a playlist and play samples of them. The website displays the album artwork, and when clicked it plays a sample of that song.

projects.name: Like Pong, but in space.
projects.description: When we were working on creating a game using Phaser, we had a lecture where we created the classic game Pong with some updated graphics. We made it as a multiplayer game but I wanted to be able to play it alone, so afterwards I rewrote some of the code and created my own computer bot to play against.

projects.name: Food blog using Wordpress REST API
projects.description: This was my first project at Hyper Island. I created a personal food blog using the Wordpress as a CMS and their REST API to fetch the content. Making it so I easily could add blog posts in the future, without having to open the code again.

projects.name: Radio app using Sveriges Radio API
projects.description: Radio app using the Sveriges Radio API. The goal with this project was to recreate a previous project I had made in vanilla Javascript to get a better understanding of how the code translates into React code. During this process I really wanted to focus on developing for mobile first and also maintainability.

projects.name: Endless runner game
projects.description: This is one of my favourite group projects so far. Me and a classmate created an endless runner game using Phaser as the framework. It was fun because of how different it was from basic Javascript, we had to do a lot of debugging and error researching. Which I thought was a great learning experience

projects.name: Application website to Hyper Island
projects.description: This is the website I made when I applied to Hyper Island. I made it as a part of my application task to provide proof I had knowledge in HTML / CSS as this was one of the requirements. During this project, my main focus was responsiveness.
